title: zeebly
author: zeebly
content: If you from Hungary, a Daredevil and wanna make some GOO MONEY BY TOMORROW hit me up. Strictly Hungarians.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: zeebly on October 02, 2022, 06:30:51 PMIf you from Hungary, a Daredevil and wanna make some GOO MONEY BY TOMORROW hit me up. Strictly Hungarians.What kind of weird offer is this? I'm sorry, but I don't think this is going to work outIf you're really serious, why don't you tell us what it is you really want, then maybe we can get down to business, and maybe I'll tell you if I'm from Hungary or not.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: decodx on October 02, 2022, 06:57:43 PMWhat kind of weird offer is this? I'm sorry, but I don't think this is going to work outIf you're really serious, why don't you tell us what it is you really want, then maybe we can get down to business, and maybe I'll tell you if I'm from Hungary or not.I'd guess that if he tells more he will end up with some more negative feedback...This way he keeps an air of secrecy and maybe some fool jumps in.

comments.author: zeebly
comments.body: I think my thread says it all... Strictly Hungary, if not... PASS.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: zeebly on October 03, 2022, 09:48:58 AMI think my thread says it all... Strictly Hungary, if not... PASS. The reference from your trust score that require you to speak in detail about every offer you will make, none other than knowing the level of risk in the distribution of business profits. It's fine if you choose privately, just reminding the Hungarians here (if any), if necessary it has to be verified by some people for the sake of transparency.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: So you just had to wake up your inactive account only to start searching for a "daredevil" from Hungary who could be your next victim with your malicious schemes?Foremost, your trust rating along speaks more about you;Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=885589 TMAN    2019-04-18    Reference    asking for loans with shit collateral, not reading the rules - dont deal with this foolNobody should think about dealing with you if they want to stay clear off scam.

comments.author: zeebly
comments.body: All you people ever think of is scamming not even a possibility of someone really making money with other people  . Am not interested in scamming anyone and yes I still insist. I need money hungry Hungarians to work with, Thank you!

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: zeebly on October 05, 2022, 03:30:22 PMAll you people ever think of is scamming not even a possibility of someone really making money with other people  . Am not interested in scamming anyone and yes I still insist. I need money hungry Hungarians to work with, Thank you!You activity is suspicious so yes people are right to believe that you are out to scam. This forum is full of scammers since scam is not moderated. Better safe than sorry. On a positive note, we do have genuine and legit traders around but their reputation speaks for them.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: bitgov on October 11, 2022, 12:08:06 AMthat is a scam - and also I dont feel like pulling myself to word the online money deals .. Although I am living in Hungry for past 10 years - but there are so many scams around that I have lost all trust in people Have you lost faith in yourself? I ask because it is somewhat ironic that you talk about so many scams, and you promote one of them in your signature.Quote from: decodx on October 02, 2022, 06:57:43 PMIf you're really serious, why don't you tell us what it is you really want, then maybe we can get down to business, and maybe I'll tell you if I'm from Hungary or not.I don't know what it is about, but if the OP doesn't want to publicly define what it is about, then we can assume that it's not exactly something completely legal. He probably needs some documents for verification, payment to a bank account in Hungary or something similar.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on October 12, 2022, 12:54:26 PMI ask because it is somewhat ironic that you talk about so many scams, and you promote one of them in your signature.He has lost faith in people since he has seen with his own eyes how many have got scammed by his own advertised services, and judging by the still-appearing posts of users losing money with that casino, yeah it's sure one can lose it  Quote from: Lucius on October 12, 2022, 12:54:26 PMI don't know what it is about, but if the OP doesn't want to publicly define what it is about, then we can assume that it's not exactly something completely legal. He probably needs some documents for verification, payment to a bank account in Hungary or something similar.Maybe not even that, he might be fishing for some that intrigued by the request, why only Hungary, then in an act of pure generosity even if you're from Chile he lets you on this secret money-making scheme, he's making an exception just for you, he won't be making as much money as usual but he will share it, seen this kind of bait before, the gullible wanted desperately to make some money will still fall for the temptation.Quote from: zeebly on October 05, 2022, 03:30:22 PMAm not interested in scamming anyone and yes I still insist. I need money hungry Hungarians to work with, Thank you!Perfectly worded up, ss I was saying, from gullible greedy eager to help user to a scam victim is only one tiny step, all it takes is on PM and you're done for.
